Package io.mrshannon.hexmek.models

Interface Movable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Unit
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractUnit, Mech, Vehicle
    public interface Movable

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean canMove()
      Determine whether or not the object can be moved or not.
      void cruise()
      Begin cruising movement (slowest, but with backwards movement), resting modifiers and movement points.
      void flank()
      Begin flanking movement (fastest, no backwards movement), resting modifiers and movement points.
      int getCruiseMovementPoints()
      Get the number of movement points that are available when cruising.
      Direction getFacing()
      Get the current facing direction of the unit.
      int getFlankMovementPoints()
      Get the number of movement points that are available when flanking.
      Hex getHex()
      Get the current hex coordinate of the unit.
      int getMovementPoints()
      Get remaining movement points.
      void halt()
      Begin halting movement (no movement), resting modifiers and movement points.
      void moveBackward()
      Move unit backward one hexagonal coordinate.
      void moveForward()
      Move unit forward one hexagonal coordinate.
      void rotateLeft()
      Rotate unit right (1 direction).
      void rotateRight()
      Rotate unit right (1 direction).

    • Method Detail

      • getHex

        Hex getHex()
        Get the current hex coordinate of the unit.
        Returns:
        current hex coordinate

      • getFacing

        Direction getFacing()
        Get the current facing direction of the unit.
        Returns:
        current facing direction

      • getMovementPoints

        int getMovementPoints()
        Get remaining movement points.
        Movement points are required to move.
        Returns:
        remaining movement points

      • getCruiseMovementPoints

        int getCruiseMovementPoints()
        Get the number of movement points that are available when cruising.
        Returns:
        total cruising movement points

      • getFlankMovementPoints

        int getFlankMovementPoints()
        Get the number of movement points that are available when flanking.
        Returns:
        total flanking movement points

      • canMove

        boolean canMove()
        Determine whether or not the object can be moved or not.
        Returns:
        true if the object can be moved, false if it can't

      • halt

        void halt()
        Begin halting movement (no movement), resting modifiers and movement points.

      • cruise

        void cruise()
        Begin cruising movement (slowest, but with backwards movement), resting modifiers and movement points.

      • flank

        void flank()
        Begin flanking movement (fastest, no backwards movement), resting modifiers and movement points.

      • moveForward

        void moveForward()
          throws MovementPointsExhaustedException
        Move unit forward one hexagonal coordinate.
        Throws:
        MovementPointsExhaustedException - if no movement points remain
        UnsupportedOperationException - if current movement strategy does not support forward movement

      • moveBackward

        void moveBackward()
           throws MovementPointsExhaustedException
        Move unit backward one hexagonal coordinate.
        Throws:
        MovementPointsExhaustedException - if no movement points remain
        UnsupportedOperationException - if current movement strategy does not support backward movement

      • rotateRight

        void rotateRight()
          throws MovementPointsExhaustedException
        Rotate unit right (1 direction).
        Throws:
        MovementPointsExhaustedException - if no movement points remain
        UnsupportedOperationException - if current movement strategy does not support rotation to the right

      • rotateLeft

        void rotateLeft()
         throws MovementPointsExhaustedException
        Rotate unit right (1 direction).
        Throws:
        MovementPointsExhaustedException - if no movement points remain
        UnsupportedOperationException - if current movement strategy does not support rotation to the left
